summary: Bran fell asleep, and when he woke his whole family was gone. He fled Theon and his wrath, and eventually became the Three Eyed...
body: Bran fell asleep, and when he woke his whole family was gone. He fled Theon and his wrath, and eventually became the Three Eyed Raven, but Brandon Stark, a son of Winterfell, was put into a coma, woke up, and he, as himself, never saw his family again.

reblog.comment: Bran fell asleep, and when he woke his whole family was gone. He fled Theon and his wrath, and eventually became the Three Eyed Raven, but Brandon Stark, a son of Winterfell, was put into a coma, woke up, and he, as himself, never saw his family again.

summary:
Thinking about Bran getting angry and chasing Arya after she shoots his target during archery practice when they were kids
Then...
body:
Thinking about Bran getting angry and chasing Arya after she shoots his target during archery practice when they were kids

Then so many years later during the Battle for Winterfell he hands her his weapon to fight on his behalf, finally realizing that she could do what he couldn’t and that they both have a different kind of strength. That they were always stronger together than apart


He would guide her arrow and she would hit the mark for him

summary: Seriously, I think it's not over, Bran know something more,he seeing something else coming.
question: Seriously, I think it's not over, Bran know something more,he seeing something else coming.
answer: Bran is suspicious to say the least. There are still so many missing pieces to the puzzle, I wouldn’t be surprised if Bran turned out to be a villain or at least an antihero this whole time.

title: fic: “alive and whole”
body:
AO3 or FFN

~1k, Jon & Sansa & Arya & Bran, G-rating, Season 8

Summary: Arya tugs out the catspaw, its Valyrian steel glinting in the light. She holds it out to Jon, as if a knight would regally present out their sword for a king’s blessing. “Like you said… I stuck him with the pointy end,” Arya says, cocking an eyebrow.

bc i'm in absolute denial that he's gone
summary: rewatching the episode again bc i’m trash but it’s such a small moment that just keeps hitting me square in the face the moment...
body:
rewatching the episode again bc i’m trash but it’s such a small moment that just keeps hitting me square in the face

the moment where you see theon wheeling bran towards the godswood just hits me like a train

the only other person we’ve seen wheeling bran around winterfell in that chair is arya, his sister. we haven’t witnessed anyone else do that, even within his own family. bran is in a position where he can’t exactly do much when he’s being moved to defend himself, were anyone to try and hurt him.

and despite everything theon has done, for some reason, this to me is the ultimate sign of how the starks completely trust and forgive him now.

he’s trusted to be the one to take bran to the godswood, he’s trusted to be the core protector of bran, just as we’ve seen arya do in season 7.

because bran is theon’s brother. and theon is bran’s brother. he’s trusted, and he’s forgiven.

it’s such a small, small moment, but it just absolutely attacks me every time i see it.

summary:
Has expected the latest GoT killed me ! Did I saw it coming ? Yeah. Did I was still scared for 80 minutes ? Sure 
This episode...
body:
Has expected the latest GoT killed me ! Did I saw it coming ? Yeah. Did I was still scared for 80 minutes ? Sure 

This episode didn’t disappointed me at all. The scenery and the battle and the picture and music in this episode was excellent. Now into the feelings

- First the ending : Did I expected the Night King to be killed into this episode. Honestly no I thought that the war between the living and the dead to last two episode but I wasn’t disappointed because this ending though !!! My girl Arya did it !!!!!! I didn’t expected that she would be the one to kill the Night King. But when I think about it it’s totally logical I mean she’s a trained assassin she was one of the people who had a chance to do it and seeing her winning the war, killing the enemy that we know and fear for 8 seasons was great. Her character growth is one of the best I’ve ever seen or read and it was great. Her scenes in the library, her chase in Winterfell, the fact that the Hound saved her. And Melisandre prophecy when they meet again and the tribute to Sirio

- Sansa and Tyrion in the crypts: let’s be honest we all see coming the fact that choosing a place with dead people to hide the people of Winterfell when the enemy can bring back the dead wasn’t the best idea. Anyway. I honestly didn’t saw coming the talk between Tyrion and Sansa, I mean it had a particular vibe about it I didn’t expected between them. Side thing : I actually appreciated Missandei coming at Sansa when she talked about Daenerys, in the aspect that it’s true she came with two dragons and two armies. But I’m not one of those persons who wants to confronts them to each other I simply liked the show of friendship and loyalty Missandei show toward Dany. I think that Sansa was actually brace to stay in the crypt, she knows she’s not a fighter, that she may have a chance to help her people in the crypt but not in the battlefield and her will to pick up the knife that Arya gave her to kill the Wrights that were here was also quite brave. 

- Dany and Jon : They fight Targaryen style with their dragons and some of the amazing shots came from these scenes in my opinion. They help a lot. I mean they burn thousands of Wrights and they give us light and they fight the Night King, who with Viseryon was kind of hard to fight for other soldiers. I also loved that this episode show the side of Dany and Jon we’ve seen in previous seasons. John is this hero who wants to fight everyone at the same time and who is sometimes a bit reckless. And Dany is the fair queen we’ve seen when she was at Esso. She wants to ride Dragon as soon as she sees that the Dothraki are losing, in part to venge them I believe. Her armies are in fact in the first line. She doesn’t try to kill Jon during the battle or even left him to die or anything she actually save him. To be honest I was a bit afraid that she would hesitate but I’m more than happy to see they didn’t get through that road. She picks up a sword even if she doesn’t know how to fight and I love a queen without survival instinct and a warrior spirit. I stan a couple that fight a war together

- Now the deaths 

I cried for Jorah and Lyanna : Jorah has been with us since the beginning and with Dany. He was loyal to no end and was also kind of the king of the friendzone but he was a likable character, wise and with a positive influence over Dany. I love Lyanna because she was badass, she wasn’t afraid to say what she was thinking and she was a warrior, she fought side by side with her army and her last act was to take down a freaking giant. We stan

Beric and Ed were also heartbreaking : Beric because we learn that he was brought back to live time and time again so he could save Arya during this battle. Ed was part of the Night Watch, he’s been friends with John and Sam forever and seeing him die during this episode was heartbreaking.

I was actually sad for Melisandre, she was awful but let’s be honest she save them during the battle with her magic and same with been with her for so long 

Edit : Theon my boy !!!! I had a complicated relationship with this character I mean he did some bad things but he still came back to Winterfell when it was needed. His death was heartbreaking because his fight is not for power but for the love he has for the Starks, for Bran who is like a brother to him and I cried during this scene a lot

I was scared for Brienne, Jamie and Podrick several time during this episode but they seems to be alive all of them which is a relief for me. 

Now we have three more episodes to survive before we know how this amazing show will end. I’ll admit something my biggest regret when it comes to GoT is that I didn’t discover the show earlier so I could enjoy it for a longer period of time.

Her armies are in fact in the first line. She doesn’t try to kill Jon during the battle or even left him to die or anything she actually save him. To be honest I was a bit afraid that she would hesitate but I’m more than happy to see they didn’t get through that road. She picks up a sword even if she doesn’t know how to fight and I love a queen without survival instinct and a warrior spirit. I stan a couple that fight a war together

- Now the deaths 

I cried for Jorah and Lyanna : Jorah has been with us since the beginning and with Dany. He was loyal to no end and was also kind of the king of the friendzone but he was a likable character, wise and with a positive influence over Dany. I love Lyanna because she was badass, she wasn’t afraid to say what she was thinking and she was a warrior, she fought side by side with her army and her last act was to take down a freaking giant. We stan

Beric and Ed were also heartbreaking : Beric because we learn that he was brought back to live time and time again so he could save Arya during this battle. Ed was part of the Night Watch, he’s been friends with John and Sam forever and seeing him die during this episode was heartbreaking.

I was actually sad for Melisandre, she was awful but let’s be honest she save them during the battle with her magic and same with been with her for so long 

Edit : Theon my boy !!!! I had a complicated relationship with this character I mean he did some bad things but he still came back to Winterfell when it was needed. His death was heartbreaking because his fight is not for power but for the love he has for the Starks, for Bran who is like a brother to him and I cried during this scene a lot

I was scared for Brienne, Jamie and Podrick several time during this episode but they seems to be alive all of them which is a relief for me. 

Now we have three more episodes to survive before we know how this amazing show will end. I’ll admit something my biggest regret when it comes to GoT is that I didn’t discover the show earlier so I could enjoy it for a longer period of time.
trail.content:
Has expected the latest GoT killed me ! Did I saw it coming ? Yeah. Did I was still scared for 80 minutes ? Sure 

This episode didn’t disappointed me at all. The scenery and the battle and the picture and music in this episode was excellent. Now into the feelings

- First the ending : Did I expected the Night King to be killed into this episode. Honestly no I thought that the war between the living and the dead to last two episode but I wasn’t disappointed because this ending though !!! My girl Arya did it !!!!!! I didn’t expected that she would be the one to kill the Night King. But when I think about it it’s totally logical I mean she’s a trained assassin she was one of the people who had a chance to do it and seeing her winning the war, killing the enemy that we know and fear for 8 seasons was great. Her character growth is one of the best I’ve ever seen or read and it was great. Her scenes in the library, her chase in Winterfell, the fact that the Hound saved her. And Melisandre prophecy when they meet again and the tribute to Sirio

- Sansa and Tyrion in the crypts: let’s be honest we all see coming the fact that choosing a place with dead people to hide the people of Winterfell when the enemy can bring back the dead wasn’t the best idea. Anyway. I honestly didn’t saw coming the talk between Tyrion and Sansa, I mean it had a particular vibe about it I didn’t expected between them. Side thing : I actually appreciated Missandei coming at Sansa when she talked about Daenerys, in the aspect that it’s true she came with two dragons and two armies. But I’m not one of those persons who wants to confronts them to each other I simply liked the show of friendship and loyalty Missandei show toward Dany. I think that Sansa was actually brace to stay in the crypt, she knows she’s not a fighter, that she may have a chance to help her people in the crypt but not in the battlefield and her will to pick up the knife that Arya gave her to kill the Wrights that were here was also quite brave. 

- Dany and Jon : They fight Targaryen style with their dragons and some of the amazing shots came from these scenes in my opinion. They help a lot. I mean they burn thousands of Wrights and they give us light and they fight the Night King, who with Viseryon was kind of hard to fight for other soldiers. I also loved that this episode show the side of Dany and Jon we’ve seen in previous seasons. John is this hero who wants to fight everyone at the same time and who is sometimes a bit reckless. And Dany is the fair queen we’ve seen when she was at Esso. She wants to ride Dragon as soon as she sees that the Dothraki are losing, in part to venge them I believe. Her armies are in fact in the first line. She doesn’t try to kill Jon during the battle or even left him to die or anything she actually save him. To be honest I was a bit afraid that she would hesitate but I’m more than happy to see they didn’t get through that road. She picks up a sword even if she doesn’t know how to fight and I love a queen without survival instinct and a warrior spirit. I stan a couple that fight a war together

- Now the deaths 

I cried for Jorah and Lyanna : Jorah has been with us since the beginning and with Dany. He was loyal to no end and was also kind of the king of the friendzone but he was a likable character, wise and with a positive influence over Dany. I love Lyanna because she was badass, she wasn’t afraid to say what she was thinking and she was a warrior, she fought side by side with her army and her last act was to take down a freaking giant. We stan

Beric and Ed were also heartbreaking : Beric because we learn that he was brought back to live time and time again so he could save Arya during this battle. Ed was part of the Night Watch, he’s been friends with John and Sam forever and seeing him die during this episode was heartbreaking.

I was actually sad for Melisandre, she was awful but let’s be honest she save them during the battle with her magic and same with been with her for so long 

Edit : Theon my boy !!!! I had a complicated relationship with this character I mean he did some bad things but he still came back to Winterfell when it was needed. His death was heartbreaking because his fight is not for power but for the love he has for the Starks, for Bran who is like a brother to him and I cried during this scene a lot

I was scared for Brienne, Jamie and Podrick several time during this episode but they seems to be alive all of them which is a relief for me. 

Now we have three more episodes to survive before we know how this amazing show will end. I’ll admit something my biggest regret when it comes to GoT is that I didn’t discover the show earlier so I could enjoy it for a longer period of time.

summary: Por qué nadie hizo nada cuando Arya se acercó a Night King
title: Por qué nadie hizo nada cuando Arya se acercó a Night King
body:
Por qué nadie hizo nada cuando Arya se acercó a Night King

Este es mi aporte al debate de Game of Thrones temporada 8 episodio 3. 🙂 Vi el episodio con mis amigos y lo disfruté al máximo. Me encanta cómo sucedieron las cosas y el hecho que Arya haya sido la que matara a Night King hace todo el sentido del mundo.

A algunas personas no les agrada esto porque esperaban que fuera Jon Snow, esperaban una batalla 1 a 1, esperaban que Melissandre se…

blog.description:
iss your ~problematic~ fave |  JON SNOW | CLERITH | CLOUD STRIFE | 
 JONERYS | 
MATT MURDOCK | SPACE |  karedevil | kastle | mattelektra | ben poindexter | RICK GRIMES | richonne | CARYL | ichiruki | sasusaku | GAME OF THRONES | aliens | synthwave | the walking dead (1-6) ♥

summary: More Proof Bran Was Helping the Night King
title: More Proof Bran Was Helping the Night King
body:
As I’ve explained already in my previous post, Bran spends the entirety of the Battle of Winterfell warging. After Theon tells him that the trenches have been lit, Bran wargs into the ravens and flies up to surround the Night King. It’s in this exact moment  that the Night King realizes that the wights are unable to make it over Winterfell’s walls due to the fiery trenches, so the Night King remedies this by making some wights fall onto the fire to make bridges for other wights to cross over.

The important detail here is that Bran’s ravens surround the Night King, and the NK does not seem bothered at all by their presence, coupled with the fact that the NK only gets his solution for the wights to cross over the trenches after Bran’s ravens surround him. 

Now let’s go back to episode 5 of season 7, Eastwatch:

Bran Wargs into the ravens and fly north of the Wall. He finds the Army of the Dead and…


as soon as the Night King spots Bran’s ravens, The Night King does *something* to break Bran’s warging trance and the ravens scatter away. The reason the Night King does this is because he doesn’t want Bran to discover his plan to attack Eastwatch. 

Which brings us back to episode 3 of season 8, The Long Night:

The Night King does not interfere with Bran’s ravens, he doesn’t even acknowledge them in a negative way. Instead, they simply fly towards him and he suddenly raises his hand to make the wights start invading Winterfell.

Why does the Night King stop Bran’s ravens in season 7, episode 5…. but not during the most important fight of the Night King’s existence? 

Surely if Bran was doing that to spy on the Night King and then tell the others where he was, the Night King would have stopped Bran. But he doesn’t. Instead, we see the Night King suddenly intervene with the defense of Winterfell after ignoring Bran’s ravens.

I’ve said it once, and I’ll say it again… something is not right.
